name: Palaw
description: A central dish in Turkmen cuisine, Palaw (or pilaf) is a rice dish cooked with pieces of meat, usually lamb, carrots, onions, and a generous amount of Turkmen saffron.
steps: Heat oil in a large pot and brown the lamb pieces until golden.
Add chopped onions and grated carrots to the pot and saut√© until softened.
Stir in rice, Turkmen saffron, and enough boiling water to cover the ingredients.
Cook on low heat until the rice is fluffy and all the liquid is absorbed.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh herbs.
ingredients: 2 cups long-grain rice, washed and drained
tips: Use a heavy pot to prevent the rice from burning.
Let the pilaf rest for 10 minutes after cooking before serving to allow flavors to meld.
Adjust the amount of water depending on the type of rice used.
